title: What is the maximum length of time to add copyright music to an Instagram video post? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Instagram Video length requirement depends upon the types of posts. There are 4 types of Instagram Video Posts & their Length Requirement are as follows:- Instagram Feed Video Length: 3 seconds – 1 minuteInstagram Story Video Length: Up to 15 secondsInstagram Live Video Length: Up to 1 hourIGTV Video Length: 15 seconds – 10 minutesThe maximum length of time to add copyright music to an Instagram Video Post is same as the Instagram Video Length. In case you love particular music which is copyrighted & want to add in your Video Post then here are few tips that you can get to use copyright music on Instagram, are as follows:- Give Credits to Music OwnerAsk them before PostingDo Appeal for use Music in the PostsMake slight changes in MusicFollow Instagram Copyright Music policy, etc.

You seem to be seeking a fair use exception, being aware that only part of a work can be included in yours. But fair use doesn't define how much is too much. It has to be decided Everytime someone sues. Your bigger problem is that you don't fit two of the other fair use rules. (Plus we don't know if you live in the U.S. Other countries don't have fair use.) There are a narrow set of purposes: parody or review of the included work. You description didn't say that was your plan, so you don't fall inside fair use. You are also causing the musician to lose out on the licensing fee they expert when their music is the sound track to a video. This isn't fair use. You need permission.
